page.title: 11Blue Cross Sanctuary Kimpton
page.content: {History:}This organisation originated 80 yrs. ago, taking in ponies, donkeys and dogs,especially strays. During the first world war it helped wounded cavalry horses. {Money Matters:}The Blue Cross is a national charity which relies on contributions from the public. People give money when they acquire new pets, leave bequests in their wills and have collecting boxes and flag days. {Adoption Scheme:}With this scheme people pay for a single kennel, Â£60 in cost. They do this in remembrance of a pet. A plaque in the pet's name is placed on the wall next to the kennel. {Kimpton Sanctuary:}Its land of 5 acres has 10 runs. Each run has an attached kennel block, with individual cages & a kitchen area. There is also a field for the ponies, donkeys and horses. A reception area completes the home.
